who has led Google for a decade, will become executive chairman focusing on external relations, deals and government relations.New Yorker writer Ken Auletta , who has written a book on the company, reported Friday that Eric Schmidt had been nudged aside.`` Ken Auletta said that after losing out to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin over the company's China policy a year ago,`` Eric Schmidt lost some energy and focus.`` Eric Schmidt was also criticized for allowing Google to be overtaKen Auletta by Facebook, for the company's increasingly frequent privacy scandals and its increasing internal bureaucracy. executive chairman,`` a lot of my time'' will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said.`` We've got very complicated government issues,'' he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries.
